attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2016-0174

Date: 2016-03-24

His Excellency the Governor General in Council, thinking it necessary, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice, pursuant to subsection 19(2) of the Tax Court of Canada Act, advises that Commissions do issue under the Great Seal of Canada empowering each of the persons of the Courts Administration Service whose name is set out in the annexed schedule to administer oaths and to take and receive affidavits, declarations and solemn affirmations, within or outside Canada, in or concerning any proceeding had or to be had in the Tax Court of Canada.


 

Sur recommandation de la ministre de la Justice et en vertu du paragraphe 19(2) de la Loi sur la Cour canadienne de l’impôt, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil, l’estimant nécessaire, ordonne que soient délivrées des commissions, sous le grand sceau du Canada, habilitant chacune des personnes du Service administratif des tribunaux judiciaires dont le nom figure à l’annexe ci-jointe à recevoir, au Canada ou à l’étranger, les serments, affidavits, affirmations solennelles ou autre déclarations relatifs à une procédure engagée ou à engager devant la Cour canadienne de l’impôt.

 

 


SCHEDULE

 

Hazel Buchanan of Calgary, Alberta;

Maxim Didkovski of Montréal, Quebec;

Amanda Dunn of Vancouver, British Columbia;

Cheryl Gabel of Regina, Saskatchewan;

Victoria Gawn of Calgary, Alberta;

Modelisa Hennessy of Vancouver, British Columbia;

Linda Laberge of Winnipeg, Manitoba;

Marie-Ève Laroche of Montréal, Quebec;

Félix Larose-Chevalier of Montréal, Quebec;

Darquise Lozier of Ottawa, Ontario;

Beverly McDonald of Regina, Saskatchewan;

Véronique Olivier of Montréal, Quebec;

Johanne Pinel of Québec, Quebec;

Sean Prouse of Gatineau, Quebec;

Naveen Sarai of Calgary, Alberta;

Julie Vincent of Winnipeg, Manitoba;

Dale Waterman of Gatineau, Quebec;

Bonita Werezak of Saskatoon, Saskatchewan; and

Catharine Wilson of Fredericton, New Brunswick.
